Creates a leaf containing a given suffix at the position of a given character.

Parameters:

bool Trie::exactWordFound (  char *  inputWord  ) 
 

Searches for a specific word in the trie.

If the word is found, the searching stops. This method is used only if no spelling errors are allowed.

Parameters:
inputWord The word to search for
Returns:
True if the inputword was in the trie, false otherwise

Definition at line 207 of file TrieStruct.h.

References StringSearchUtility::getLevDist().

int Trie::getLevDist (  const char *  a,
const char *  b,
uint16  maxDist
)  [inline, static]
 

Calculates the distance between two strings, if the distance is within a certain limit.

Examples: $(a,b)$ = (Baravägen, Braavägen) => distance = 2

$(a,b)$ = (Baravägen, Bravgen) => distance = 2

$(a,b)$ = (Baravägen, Baravägenn) => distance = 1

Parameters:
a,b Words to calculate the distance between
maxDist Maximum allowed distance
return The distance if it is less than or equal to maxDist, -1 otherwise

Definition at line 201 of file TrieStruct.h.

References StringSearchUtility::getLevDist().

Definition at line 110 of file TrieStruct.h.

vector<Trie::results> Trie::getSearchResults (  const char *  inputWord,
TrieNonLeafNode *  root,
const uint16  maxDistance
) 
 

Searches for all the words close enough to the input word.

Parameters:
inputWord The word to search for
root The root of the trie
maxDistance Maximum number of errors allowed for input word, e.g. one forgotten letter, one extra letter or one wrong letter means that the distance is 1
return A vecor containing the names of all matches and the corresponding distance. The vector is sorted according to increasing distance.

void Trie::insert (  char *  newWord  ) 
 

Inserts a word in the trie.

Parameters:
newWord The word to be inserted

int Trie::position (  TrieNonLeafNode *  p,
char  ch
)  [private]
 

Tries to find the position of a letter in a word.

Parameters:
p pointer to a word in a non-leaf node
ch letter to find in the word p points at
Returns:
The position of ch in the word p points at If no position is found, -1 is returned

void Trie::searchTargetWords (  vector< results > &  resultVec,
int  depth,
TrieNonLeafNode *  p,
char *  prefix,
const char *  testWord,
const uint16  maxDistance
) 
 

Searches for all the words close enough to the input word.

Called in method getSearchresults(const char* , TrieNonLeafNode*, const uint16)

Parameters:
resultVec In - and outparameter. A vecor containing the names of all matches and the corresponding distance. The vector is sorted according to increasing distance.
p Pointer to an non-leaf node, initially the trie root
prefix The beginning of a word in the trie
testWord The word to search for
maxDistance Maximum number of errors allowed for input word
return A vector containing the names of all matches and the corresponding distance. The vector is sorted according to increasing distance.
